message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.DB. 

This paper deals with the compilation of logic programs, which is a topic that falls under the scope of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper specifically focuses on ordered logic programs, which are a type of logic programming language (cs.PL) that allows for the specification of preferences among rules. The paper also discusses the transformation of ordered logic programs into regular extended logic programs, which involves the manipulation of logical formulas (cs.LO). The resulting extended logic programs can be used with existing logic programming systems, which are software engineering tools (cs.SE) that provide a framework for reasoning about logical formulas. Finally, the paper's discussion of answer sets and preferred answer sets is relevant to the field of databases (cs.DB), which deals with the storage and retrieval of structured data.
